info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 8:38PM EDT until August 03 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 900 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MCDOWELL...NORTHWESTERN RUTHERFORD AND SOUTHEASTERN BUNCOMBE COUNTIES... At 837 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 16 miles east of Downtown Asheville, or 4 miles north of Bat Cave, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Black Mountain, Swannanoa, Old Fort, Chimney Rock Village, Chimney Rock State Park, Shingle Hollow, Lake Lure, Montreat and Bat Cave. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
